body.name: Bissell Smart Purifier with HEPA and Carbon Filters for Large Room and Home, Quiet Bedroom Air Cleaner for Allergies, Pets, Dust, Dander, Pollen, Smoke, Odors, Auto Mode, air220, 2609A
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Sunday, February 18. Order within 16 hrs 45 mins
features: 3-Stage Filtration for Simply Clean Air. Includes a pre-filter, activated carbon filter, and an H13 HEPA filter to capture large and fine particles, home odors, odors from pet, and VOCs.

Medical-grade HEPA Filter. Captures 99.97% of particles 0.3 microns and smaller when on lowest fan speed, helping to remove airborne allergens and irritants like dust, pet dander, pollen, and smoke like that from wildfires, cooking, and smoking.

Honeycomb-Structured Carbon Filter. Filter contains thousands of activated carbon pellets engineered to capture gases, volatile organic compounds (VOCs) and common household odors including odors from pets, cooking and smoke.

Large Room Coverage and AHAM Certified. Filters 1252 sq. ft. with 1 air change/hour. Filters 626 sq. ft. with 2 air changes/hour. Filters 417 sq. ft. with 3 air changes/hour. Filters rooms 258 sq. ft. providing 4.8 air changes/hour.
Low Energy and Library Quiet. Energy Star rated and equipped with 5 fan speeds the lowest of which is as quiet as a library.
Automated CirQulate System. VOC sensor monitors and provides colored-coded, indoor air quality feedback and adjusts to the appropriate fan speed for continuous clean air.
Whisper Quiet Sound Level. Equipped with 5 fan speeds the lowest of which is whisper quiet. Perfect for bedrooms and contributes to a peaceful sleeping environment.
Optimized Airflow. Powerful XL fan draws air in through the front of the air purifier and through 3 filters, releasing clean air through the top of the machine.

Easy Filter Maintenance. Filter change indicator will inform you when it’s time for new filters. Filters should be replaced approximately every 6 months. Only use genuine BISSELL Replacement Filters to ensure excellent performance. Search AMAZON ASIN: B09BP4FW9F.
body.description: Introducing BISSELL® air220 Air Purifier. This machine packs powerful indoor air purifying power into a simplistic and sleek machine, bringing form and function together in your home. The unique design is apparent in air220's clean lines and smooth edges. Underneath the sleek design you'll find three layers of filtration, including an activated carbon filter and a HEPA + pre-filter for hair, dust, pollen, dander, home and pet odors, and volatile organic compounds (VOCs). This air purifier is a powerful machine you'd expect from BISSELL, a trusted homecare brand. air220 has a soft-touch dial that lets you control both fan speed and power. It has a discrete cord wrap on the back panel and filters that can be accessed from the front panel, so you can keep it against a wall in your home. air220 cleans the air in a 266 square foot room making it perfect for bedrooms, living areas, basements, and dining rooms. You’ve trusted BISSELL to clean and care for the floors and surfaces in your home. Now, let us clean your air! Plus, every purchase of this product helps save pets. BISSELL® proudly supports BISSELL Pet Foundation® and its mission to help save homeless pets. When you buy a BISSELL product, you help save pets, too. We’re proud to design products that help make pet messes, odors and pet homelessness disappear.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Designed for Large Rooms air220 air purifier filters the air in a 258 ft² room 4.8 times per hour (or about every 12 minutes) to effectively capture dust, pollen, pet dander, smoke, and odors. Reliable Performance from a Trusted Brand Includes a medical-grade H13 HEPA filter to effectively capture 99.97% of particles 0.3 microns and smaller when on lowest fan speed. Every Purchase Saves Pets BISSELL proudly supports BISSELL Pet Foundation and its mission to help save homeless pets.

Three-Stage Filtration Air is drawn in the front of the air purifier and through the pre-, HEPA and carbon filters, cleaning allergens, irritants and odors from the air and releasing clean air out the top of the machine. Pre-Filter The first layer of filtration is responsible for capturing large particles like dust and hair from your air. Medical-Grade H13 HEPA Filter The HEPA filter captures 99.97% of particles 0.3 microns and smaller on the lowest fan speed like pollen, dust, pet dander, and smoke like that from tobacco, wildfires and cooking. Activated Carbon Filter The final layer of filtration, the activated carbon filter, traps home odors from pets, cooking and smoking as well as potentially harmful VOCs.

Expertly Designed Easy Filter Access The air220’s filters are easily accessible from the front, meaning the air purifier can be placed against the wall and out of the way. Cord Storage Rear cord storage and concealment solution means less extra cord lying on the ground. Intuitive Dial Control Dial and single button control easily allows you to adjust fan speed, power and reset your filter life. Industrial Grade Large Fan High velocity, five-speed fan, effectively pulls air through the three filters to aid in effectively capturing allergens, odors and irritants.
Allergens & Irritants Enter Our Homes Every Day

Simply Clean Air from BISSELL AHAM Verified Independently tested to the AHAM standard for room air cleaners and AHAM Verified for Clean Air Delivery Rates (CADR) of 167 CFM smoke, 178 CFM pollen, and 177 CFM dust. Large Room Coverage AHAM certified to filter rooms 258 sq. ft. providing 4.8 air changes per hour, or one turn every 12 minutes. Filters 417 sq. ft. with three air changes per hour. Filters 626 sq. ft. with two air changes per hour. Filters 1252 sq. ft. with one air change per hour.
Simply Clean Air From a Trusted Brand in Homecare

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Quiet, powerful, smart HEPA device.
reviews.reviewText: I bought two of these to help keep the air in our home cleaner especially with wildfire smoke in late summer/early fall and having a purifier with a HEPA filter is necessary when you’re dealing with that. My favorite things about it is it was easy to put together (take plastic off of filters and unit) then plug it in and let it run about 30 min for the first time. It’s got an Auto feature that is sensitive to changes in air quality indoors and will auto adjust the fan power and display a different color to indicate the air quality. I like how quiet it is, and how it auto dims when the room is dark so the bright display light isn’t a bother, either. As others have mentioned you can put the unit right against the wall because it draws air in through the front of the unit and out the top, which is great if you don’t want it in the middle of a room where you have to worry about tripping over a cord. I chose this unit over the next model up from Bissell because I felt like having an actual AQI number displayed might make me obsess over having that much info and I felt like having a color system was a bit more calming “blue = good” “yellow = moderate” “red = unhealthy” sometimes less data is a good thing - plus you can always look up the AQI online easily if you really need to know (some websites even offer AQI forecasts so you know when you may need to bust one of these babies out to use them!)My only qualm with the unit is there isn’t really a super easy way to carry it from room to room because of the design of it. If they redesign these at any point they could make a kind of sneaky indented handle situation in the recessed areas on the front and back of the unit so you can carry it with two hands would be good.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Absolutely Life Changing
reviews.reviewText: This filter does its job, and it does it incredibly well.This investment, to protect your lungs during a respiratory pandemic, is absolutely a no brainer.Having real time air quality data, via the color light indicator, is an absolute perfect addition.It's a data driven approach, being able to know the air is of good quality or not.The filters are thick, heavy duty, and way more impressive than others on the market.I did significant research, and looked extensively into similar options at slightly different price points.However, you will not find an option, with better filters, which cost this little to replace.$35 every 6 months? Are you kidding? Look up any of the cheaper, other brand name top sellers here on amazon, you'll usually find a cost of $60 to $80 for a single filter replacement, which, regardless of filter, is generally replaced on a semi annual basis. These filters are quality. Bissell isn't messing around.Additionally, I'm a huge fan of good design. I was considering paying $100 more for the white version, because I have a very modern sky rise apartment, which keeps me keen to consider design always. However, after reading another review, I realized that having the actual *number* of your AQI versus a simple color, would probably make me a little neurotic. I like knowing the air is either good, moderate, or bad... but seeing the actual number... that might actually make me a little too obsessive.I did want to talk too about the sound. On the highest setting, sleeping with it right beside my bed, it's blissful. It sounds like a white noise machine and never gets too loud for me. I love it. I generally prefer the second to the highest setting. I'd like to add that there's an incredible night time feature, which I think auto detects lighting or something, but all lighting on the unit turns off when the surrounding lights are off. I'm beyond impressed. It's so nice to not have to cover any lights up on the unit.This product, is an absolute design award worthy product. The quality, the consideration of each component, the technology and the effectiveness have me shook. Great work Bissell. I'm a huge fan.I'm incredibly satisfied. I have a 700sq ft apartment but am considering a second unit just for the hell of it. Feels like I'm living in a Tesla model X on the bio defense air filtration mode.An incredible purchase. Don't hesitate.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It’s worth it
reviews.reviewText: APPEARANCES:It’s big. The size immediately stands out when you open it. But that’s something understood for a purifier that’s purifies up to 800 sq ft. It’s sleek and beautiful. If you can find a nice place for, it looks great.SETUP:This equipment is extremely easy to setup. Install the filters it comes with. Plug it in. Press the power button, let it automatically calibrate and then it’s good to go.PERFORMANCE:It has 5 manually modes. When all the way up on 5, the fan can be heard. It’s a bearable sound though, like a nice ambient sound. At the lowest fan speed, you can’t hear it at all. It’s definitely whisper quiet. It shouldn’t be necessary to run it at the highest fan speed 99% of the time. The automatic mode is the best option. The particle sensor that is said to detect air quality seems to work pretty well, and it will automatically adjust fan speed based on its readings.Almost two weeks in, and the difference is noticeable. I’m in an apartment less than 700 sq ft. Two people. The accumulation of dust on furniture has been significantly reduced. I’m not an allergy sufferer, but my partner is. It appears to be helping reduce the allergens causing her flair ups, but more time is needed to solidify this claim.OVERALL:I’ve never spent money on an air purifier, let alone this kind of money. But I bit the bullet and gave it a try, and it’s well worth the money. Between the purifier and the top of the line Honeywell Filter I use for my HVAC system, the air quality in my apartment is optimal

Tenemos 2 semanas usándolo y hasta ahorita encantados, no produce ruido exagerado, el aire sale por arria y el panel de los filtros esta por delante esto facilita sonde acomodarlo y poderlo pegar ala pared sin que ocupe espacio.

I chose this unit because it looks good and it turns out it works good too! Auto mode detects when I’m cooking or when the air quality is lower and automatically amps it up for a bit until the air quality returns to normal. Very pleased with my purchase.

Pour la maison il fonctionne très bien et n'est pas bruyant. La nuit le voyant s'éteint ce qui est très bien sauf que je n'arrive pas à enregistrer la garantie parce que le lien nous conduit sur un site Américain et si on est au Canada pas de garantie...
Pour changer l’air de la maison et sa fonctionne très bien l’air est beaucoup mieux pour le moment sa fait seulement 1 semaine que je l’ai donc à suivre
